TopicTitle: Let sombody else do it!! Pay a contractor to fly a mission for you.

Articles.Content:
I had a thought today, why not have a system where the player could pay kerbucks to have things delivered to orbit, or farther out.

a simple example would be fuel,

If you want an orange fuel tank delivered to LKO you should be able to issue a contract for bid, and then select from 5 or so different contractors to deliver it.

It should be fairly simple to add a system to calculate the expected cost to put a known mass in a certain orbit, beyond this there are multipliers for more specific place ment such as:

rendezvous (match orbits with target)

dock with

and also multipliers to do the contract faster.

beyond Kerbin SOI it would be slightly more complicated, as you would have to factor in launch windows, but it should be do-able.

Beyond delivering fuel you could also have craft or subassemblies delivered. Or to have things recovered, probes, landers or kerbals.
The only way this could work is if this were a stupidly expensive contract. So that there is no incentive to abuse it because the player is not good at building or piloting cost efficient lifters.

I would expect that the cost would be equal with what you might be paid to fly a similar mission, with a similar time window.

The cost would increase as you add complications, for example, wanting a jumbo-64 in LKO in a month vs a year.
If you're going to do this, might as well have a corporate space race going on, where you actually have to compete for contracts with rival groups.
This would be a good system if the game manages to evolve from space contractor into something more like running a space program
